website_summaries.verdict: A cute model for girls that has some convenient features, but may not be ideal for larger children.
pros: A cute model for girls with no splash guard to get in the way
We love its arm rests that provide extra comfort and one-piece bowl that's easy to clean
cons: It runs a bit on the smaller side, and the height adjustment feature might not be enough to accommodate all girls

customer_reviews.title: this little potty is easy to use for my little princess as well as ...
customer_reviews.text: Not all little girls want to be princesses, however, all of them must learn to sit on the throne. In the world of crappers, there is much competition for little tushes, however, I found that this one was my Number 1. Adjustable for the little one to keep feet planted on the floor with handles to hold on to for support, this little potty is easy to use for my little princess as well as easier to clean than a chamber pot after a fast food taco joint run.
customer_reviews.author: CSchel

customer_reviews.title: My 2. 5 yr old daughter is 35lbs and ...
customer_reviews.text: My 2.5 yr old daughter is 35lbs and barely fits into the seat. The seat space is so small that wide kids don't fit. She can sit but only with her legs fully closed. It's very uncomfortable for her
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality!
customer_reviews.text: My grands have 4 pottys. Another kind at their home and I purchased these for my home. Soft handles Perfect size Easy to dump Easy to wash and wipde down Here is a tip that I gave. Use diaper bags to cover the seat for poopy time. Easy to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Lady

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and is exactly as shown on the picture. I purchased it for my 7 month old to get her used to it and prepare her for potty training. I was afraid that might be too big, but it was not. Plus I love that there are handles. I strongly recommend this product, especially if you’re like me who wants to start potty training their babies early☝🏻
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best chair
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for us. Would recommend for anyone ESPECIALLY if you are training a boy. My son is 3ft tall and about 35lbs. I was hesitant that it wouldn't be comfortable for him. With the adjustable settings and arm rest, it was great. Very well made and durable easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Jacki

customer_reviews.title: Great chair for nervous toddlers
customer_reviews.text: My son was scared of other little potties and was afraid of the big potty as well so potty training started out rough! Then we went to a friends house that had this fantastic chair and he sat right down and went, he looked so relaxed, I think it felt more comfortable to him and more like a regular chair so he wasn’t scared. I immediately bought two and he was fully potty trained two weeks later. He is 2.5 now and transitioning to the big potty, but I highly recommend this chair for anyone potty training a nervous tiny person.
customer_reviews.author: Raeski

customer_reviews.title: I bought this potty for my 2 year old granddaughter ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this potty for my 2 year old granddaughter. This is my fourth grandchild and she has been by far the easiest child ever to potty train. All my daughter did was tell her this is her potty and she has been using it since with no accidents!! She absolutely loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: I like that this is a Girl chair
customer_reviews.text: We have eleven grandchildren...three girls under two...time for a new clean potty chair. I like that this is a Girl chair, without the protector for boys. I like the high arms for safety.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: comfortable and great support for infant/ toddlers bak
customer_reviews.text: I love this toilet for my 11 month old. Iwanted to introduce him to the idea of using the toilet on his own. he loves it the first time I put him on it he went to the bathroom. great support for the back and NOT high like the other training toilets. perfect I had to return other toilets because they were too high or bulky this one is PERFECT!!!
customer_reviews.author: krista

customer_reviews.title: leaves red marks, very uncomfortable to sit on for my toddler
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to start potty training my daughter. it looked like it would be comfortable for her to sit on which was my number one criterion since she’s supposed to sit on it quite regularly especially initially. well, this leaves huge red marks on her little behind, making it very uncomfortable after just a very short time. she keeps scooting around on it, trying to get comfortable. I have to bribe her to even sit on it for a little bit. pretty hard to get to successful potty training that way... I will have to look for another option
customer_reviews.author: Dorit Ernst

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly for my slim toddler.
customer_reviews.text: My toddler is of a petite and slim shape at 19 lbs. This potty chair seems to be the perfect size with room to grow. The back doesn't cause her any discomfort, and the arm rests are nice for her to have. The bowl comes out easily and she knows exactly how it fits back inside the seat. The bowl is seamless and has a polished feel to the plastic, which makes cleaning it quick and easy. It is simple with no frills, which is exactly what I wanted. I would recommend this to other parents.
customer_reviews.author: Ashersmama11

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This was nice and easy to click in place. Nice design. I didn’t realize one was designed for a boy and the other for a girl. I wasn’t aware pottys came with splash guards for boys. As a girl Mom, I decided to return this one to purchase the pink one for girls. I’m sure this one would have been fine for girls but ultimately decided to get the pink one in store.
customer_reviews.author: SweeTart85

customer_reviews.title: Great potty!!
customer_reviews.text: My little girl loves this potty chair. She's only 14 months but loves to sit on it and even use it! I'm not even forcing her to, I just wanted her to get use to seeing one before we started when she was a little older. Also, the style and design makes it fun for little girls to sit on without any messes being made. There is also a way to adjust the height of the seat for little ladies that are bit on the short side.
customer_reviews.author: Ericka_S

customer_reviews.title: I love that you can adjust the height and take out ...
customer_reviews.text: I love that you can adjust the height and take out the bowl to clean it. My daughter is very tall for a two year old and sits awkward in most potty seats. She also loves that it's like a normal chair and take to it very well.
customer_reviews.author: Erica S

customer_reviews.title: GREAT potty, especially for taller toddlers with body awareness issues
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is tall for her age, and potty training late. She has some body awareness issues, so having this chair with handles has been incredible. It's adjustable, and tall enough for her to be comfortable. She can actually get on and off with the help of the handles (she's a tentative kid), which is the best part. It's also easy to clean. We've tried three potty chairs, and this is the winner!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa M. Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Ok but better if it were bigger
customer_reviews.text: Ok potty. My son is a late bloomer and is a bit chubby so it’s hard for him to sit peeing down- that’s what he prefers tbh. It’s better for kids 18-24 months so my 3 year old is not a good candidate for this potty even though it states his age range in the product
customer_reviews.author: Teri Ann Hartley

customer_reviews.title: Good Potty Chair
customer_reviews.text: We decided to casually start potty training our 21month old. This chair is great because it has a high back and armrests. The inner bowl is easy to remove and clean. The green model also has a pee guard to prevent spraying out of the bowl. Our son is average size and the seat is snug. If we had started potty training later it might be too small for him. If your child has chunky legs it might be too tight of a fit. Overall we are satisfied with the potty seat and my son likes to sit in it.
customer_reviews.author: OC Family

customer_reviews.title: easy to clean and perfect size
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect size for my 18 month old! She loves the arm rests, and can sit comfortably for a good amount of time while she is trying to go! Easy to clean the middle of the potty pops out and i dump in the toiled and rinse during the flush! Great quality and light to carry which is nice for us since we have a 2 story home.
customer_reviews.author: Stevee MarklandTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Potty training chair
customer_reviews.text: I like the easy clean system, however, the seat pushes legs out one opening in the front and does not allow legs to spread, so when little one uses the potty the splash card was not tall enough and pee got everywhere! So I had to return... maybe It would work better for girls... or help teach your boy to push down his buddy when he pees... was not practical for our situation but it might work great for some. We switched to their penguin potty, works good. It also has a short splash guard for our son but if he has his legs wider apart it helps tilt his penis downward...
customer_reviews.author: Elton

customer_reviews.title: Great potty
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this potty while my in-laws were visiting and took over my daughter's bathroom. We put this in her room and it worked great in preventing accidents. Now we are potty training my youngest daughter and she loves sitting on the "little potty" and it gives us the flexibility to have 2 potties for both girls. It's the perfect size and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: rufiogrrrl

customer_reviews.title: Tired of cleaning up pee
customer_reviews.text: Everything about the the potty is great except for the fact that it's almost too comfy. My little girl gets too comfortable and she gets pee everywhere. She has to sit up straight and be seated all the way to the back of the potty. It doesn't help that it doesn't have that little guard in the front between their legs. Frustrating seein that the boy version it and girls doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: BosCaroline

customer_reviews.title: Pinches a bit.
customer_reviews.text: This works fine, I did notice that my kid would sit on it and move around a little bit and sometimes she make it slightly pinched if the removable Bowl lifted a little while she was sitting on it. I ended up buying another one, but my kids still insists on using both of them, and it seems to work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Clark

customer_reviews.title: Pee leaks if your child is not directly over the removeable cup part.
customer_reviews.text: Though my son liked this potty and sat well on it, I did not! It leaked pee all over the place! I was very disappointed! If pee didn't go directly on the cup, it would leak out of the cracks where the chair and removeable cup meet. Also the splash guard was very small and so pee was coming out the front too. I felt bad because my son was actually getting it and going potty in the toilet, yet pee would still be all over the floor. I was very disappointed because I really like Fisher Price stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Welton Bonner

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!!  Must buy!
customer_reviews.text: My son has done GREAT with seat since the very first time he say on it (@9 months old)! He seems very comfortable and uses the arms to hold on and push himself up and off. The color is bright and exactly what we wanted. I love that the height can adjust a little so we can raise it as he gets taller. He isnt a year old yet and has been going on the potty already! Great buy, so excited, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Hutter0440

customer_reviews.title: MUST-HAVE for new potty goers!!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this potty for travel or just simply when we’re out. We tote it to the soccer fields (and let her pop a squat behind a shed) and just keep it in our cars when the public restrooms just won’t do. I especially love the new redesign of the splatter guard - totally necessary! We have one in each of our cars and grandma’s!
customer_reviews.author: Marie K.

customer_reviews.title: well made
customer_reviews.text: I researched training potty's before purchasing this one and I'm so glad I did. I love how the potty chair has arms on it. it makes it so much easier for my toddler to stand up. its easy to clean and was easy to put together. it fits nicely between the adult toilet and bathtub when we need it out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Lola

customer_reviews.title: The best we've tried!
customer_reviews.text: Best training potty ever! We have other potties at grandparents houses, and this is the best. Adjustable height, bowl is smaller and easy to remove so that my toddler can dump contents herself, and the handles on the sides help her to sit down easily. All good things!!
customer_reviews.author: Eden Gudonis

customer_reviews.title: It’s like a small chair so she tends to have no ...
customer_reviews.text: Way more comfy for toddlers than backless or armless potties. It’s like a small chair so she tends to have no problem sitting on it for some time, even when it’s not potty time.
customer_reviews.author: Tasha Moehring

customer_reviews.title: Buy The Boy's Version For Your Girl - Girl Version Needs A Splashgaurd
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this product except for the absence of a splash guard on the girl version. Out daughter is potty trained and unless she sits ALL THE WAY back on the potty, pee will splash out the front, especially if she has a great need to go. Do yourself a favor and buy the boy's version for the splash-guard and save yourself some clean up later on. Only other con is sometimes the pot will COME OUT if our daughter stands up quickly (presumably because it sticks to her bottom).
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Wish the seat clasped
customer_reviews.text: I only gave 4 stars because id the part you pull out to the clean potty would have a clasp or something it would be so much better. My toddler just loves to pull thr seat out since it is so easy. Just imagine the disasters that can cause. Yikes. But overall i like it, my babe is on the taller side so I LOVE how you can adjust the height on it. Overall good product.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Good! Better for girls than boys
customer_reviews.text: A little bulky for traveling. Better for a girl than a boy. The pee guard is VERY low. So I have to make sure my son is sitting far back and hope his legs are closed. Otherwise it's a great little potty. I like the back rest and arm rest because he can sit there for an extended period of time and be comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: great!!!
customer_reviews.text: Little one loved this so much he potty trained in 2 days. after many starts and stops on other options. the chair is small. Not wide at all. I was very worried about this when I ordered it but my boys are not wide so it works. you will need to teach the boys to hold down. There is splash back otherwise. But it is a comfortable chair and although my older boy will pee in the toilet he still uses the potty to go number 2.
customer_reviews.author: Isabella

customer_reviews.title: Good seat!
customer_reviews.text: Got this to start training my 6 month olds. Its works great having the back and sides to support them. I really struggled to find a potty small enough for babies under 1. This one works. The hole is a bit big and hurts their butt after a little bit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THIS potty > the rest
customer_reviews.text: Got this potty yesterday and after set up my daughter immediately wanted to sit and stay seated on this potty so I knew it was a winner! Next day she was using the potty for #1s. I knew she didn’t like her old potty, and this solidifies that it was a comfort issue. Glad this potty could meet all our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Kali

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal for little boys
customer_reviews.text: I wish I hadn't opened this because I would definitely return. The 'shield' for little boys is not hollow. It really doesn't do anything. If my son isn't positioned just right, pee gets every where. I'll probably bite the bullet and buy another.
customer_reviews.author: TrAllison

customer_reviews.title: Not good for a Boy!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a simple (no sounds or lights) potty seat for my toddler. One that has good back support and adjustable height. This one fits that well and my toddler sits on it comfortably all the time. The main issue I have is if you are potty training a BOY...then the "pee shield" on this seat is way wrong! Yes it comes up in front but it is Flat...instead of being Curved In or Concave. So the pee will bounce right off of it and back on baby or his cloths. NOT GOOD!
customer_reviews.author: Midwest MamaTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: potty only used less than a week!
customer_reviews.text: We let little one pick her own potty & she chose this one. Worked out great. There are no extras on this potty to distract or seem lIke a toy. She took to it immediately! As the heading states...she was fully trained and on the regular toilet in less than a week!
customer_reviews.author: tntnaps1

customer_reviews.title: Just Right for Little People
customer_reviews.text: I brought two of these chairs for my granddaughter's house and mine. The fact that the chairs were easy to use made it easy for us to train my great-granddaughter in less than a month. The chair folds down neatly for storage. Clean up is simple. It was also a GREAT value.
customer_reviews.author: Patty P

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: The only con I have for this is that the “tray” the pee and poop goes into requires no latch or anything, so as soon as your little one hops up they can grab the compartment and dump pee everywhere. I wish there was at least a little “childproof” latch the parent had to squeeze to remove it.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha

customer_reviews.title: pee gets everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I have a 19 month boy and we liked this potty at first. We bought it as a second potty for outside, but he loved that it was new so we brought inside. I am switching back after 2 weeks of trying it inside. We have so many times where pee goes all over. He is not large, and it is like he is too small for the chair. Spend the money on a bigger, better chair.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had kept box to return. Every time my grandson pees. Half of it goes on the floor. Don’t recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: shemala

customer_reviews.title: Nice Potty
customer_reviews.text: I really like the high back on this potty so that my child will be comfortable during this potty training process. The design makes it really easy to clean compared to other ones that I have used. The only thing that could make it better would be custom liners for faster cleanup
customer_reviews.author: SE 123

customer_reviews.title: awesome potty chair
customer_reviews.text: I bought this party chair for my grandson that has a lot of health problems with the handle so high on it it made him feel safe the chair was made very well and held my grandson I even went back and ordered a second chair so I could send it two the therapy school that my grandson goes to I would highly recommend this party chair
customer_reviews.author: lonora

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.text: My son absolutely loves this thing. I swear the first day we got it, he refused to get up. It's easy to clean, has two height settings, and does not slide across the floor when he tried to sit. I call it his luxury potty
customer_reviews.author: Ashely M.

customer_reviews.title: Not great or boys
customer_reviews.text: Good size however the splash guard doesn't help much. When my son would urinate it would splash back on him and down his leg and the urine would end up running down the side and base so I would have to wipe the whole toilet down plus the floor. I'm sure this is only a problem with boys.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My darling just likes to sit in it as practice so I think it’s great so far! She’s only 10 months but she’ll begin the process soon so we wanted to be prepared! We had to clean it a few times already and it was simple and a seamless process.
customer_reviews.author: DedicatedShopper

customer_reviews.title: She peed!
customer_reviews.text: We bought 3 other potties before this one and she saw this one as welcoming, PINK, and it didn't move when she sat down (I think the previous ones seemed unstable and she got scared). Absolutely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Cola

customer_reviews.title: Not good for Boy
customer_reviews.text: Somehow someway the boy was having pee on the potty and floor 😑 We have the green one. Purchased a different brand potty and no pee anywhere thankfully
customer_reviews.author: Stass

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: not really comfy for almost 2 year old boy. seems a bit small...
customer_reviews.author: Kema

customer_reviews.title: great for small tushies since the actual opening is pretty ...
customer_reviews.text: great for small tushies since the actual opening is pretty small. if you're starting potty training early, this is a good potty to go with.
customer_reviews.author: madge

customer_reviews.title: Girl's pink potty - not good
customer_reviews.text: When my granddaughter pees, the pee comes out on the floor when she first starts peeing. There needs to be some kind of guard so the pee won't go shooting out onto the floor. I am not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry V.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: So easy. I love that the height is adjustable and how simple it is to clean! It wipes easily with a wipe or just plain running water. I haven't traveled with this yet but it folds up so I imagine it would be simple to bring along.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great potty - only downside is my son can’t spread his legs fully the way he wants to to poop because of the arm rests. He likes the potty though and I like the height adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Deitrick

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work for a boy pee is all out
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this potty for a boy the pee comes out and it’s on the floor. It might work for a girl but definitely not for boy.
customer_reviews.author: Brazenhut

customer_reviews.title: Perfect no frills potty chair
customer_reviews.text: I like this simple, no frills potty chair! It doesn't slip and slide, and has an easy to remove bowl that holds waste. There is no lid, for those that may need to wait in between times, but we dump as we go, so this works for us!
customer_reviews.author: Ameephin

customer_reviews.title: Favorite potty for potty training
customer_reviews.text: Love love love love this potty. The height is great for my little short 1 year old. This is our second potty because the first was too tall for her and left a red ring around her butt. I love that this one has arm rests and a back rest.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: This potty chair is amazing! Our daughter is very small and on the ...
customer_reviews.text: This potty chair is amazing! Our daughter is very small and on the lowest setting she fit perfectly! I would recommend this seat for any child of any size! Easy to clean and easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great First Potty Chair
customer_reviews.text: This potty is GREAT! The handles & back support make it easy for our daughter to get comfortable & the potty insert is easily removed! The only complaint would be that the insert is fairly small & doesn’t have a “splash” guard which sometimes results in a little bit of pee escaping from the front if they aren’t sitting just right!
customer_reviews.author: Ashly Franza

customer_reviews.title: The first was the summer infant my size potty which was a little too tall and my daughter didn't feel comfortable getting off and on it
customer_reviews.text: This was the second potty I bought for my daughter when she started potty training. The first was the summer infant my size potty which was a little too tall and my daughter didn't feel comfortable getting off and on it. This fisher price potty has been perfect! She uses the side handles for support when getting off and on. Easy to clean and a great price. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Krd1013

customer_reviews.title: A little early but, it works!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my little girl to get comfortable with sitting on the seat. It is great! She sits there and does her business. I don't have much of a fight with her and she is potty conditioning at 1.5 years. I am pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Kei

customer_reviews.title: Good potty seat
customer_reviews.text: We were waffling between this an another seat, and they probably both would have been fine. This one is cute and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Compston

customer_reviews.title: Splash guard doesn't work well for boys.
customer_reviews.text: The splash guard design is flat instead of scooped. Therefore, anytime our little boy goes #1, it splashes up over the guard and gets everywhere. We've tried seating him differently, but it never fails. I wouldn't buy this again, nor recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ortega David

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: The handles and high back make a big difference for children feeling secure and safe. The bowl is easy to remove and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: My son always wants to remove the cup I had to tape it in place wish it would click into place or make is difficult for him to pull out. My son does however love his potty and uses it alot.
customer_reviews.author: kayla

customer_reviews.title: Fun seat.
customer_reviews.text: Potty training my granddaughter is going great so far I love the adjustable legs she sits in the chair perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Monique Muslim

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend the one with the "boy lip" protection for girls ...
customer_reviews.text: I have bought the pink and green, both for my 2 year old little girl. I would recommend the one with the "boy lip" protection for girls too. I like the one with the little lip better because it blocks her urine from getting on her clothes and feet. Love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Garcia

customer_reviews.title: I’d recommend
customer_reviews.text: My almost 2 year old used it as soon as I put it together!!!!! It’s lightweight (she picked it up herself and decided where it was going to go lol) and the Bowl part comes out and goes back in easy enough that my 5 year old has helped clean up as well
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Great Learning Product
customer_reviews.text: My son absolutely loves this potty. It’s perfect height for him, and the comfort of the seat brings him back to use it every time. The only downfall I have is that sometimes when he doesn’t aim correctly, urine can get trapped in between the rim of the removable bowl which makes things a little messy. But it wouldn’t stop me from buying the product again, potty training is messy anyway.
customer_reviews.author: ConklinMKBE

customer_reviews.title: Potty Training Success
customer_reviews.text: We installed the toilet seats that have the child seat insert in them, but our daughter didn’t feel secure on them and always wanted to get off the seat within 5 seconds. She has loved this potty seat for training as it has handles and a back. It’s given her the confidence to use the potty seats we installed and we’ll continue to use this for travel. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Philip J. Mauch

customer_reviews.title: Great for potty training!
customer_reviews.text: Got this because it looked more like a chair and something my daughter would feel comfortable sitting on for an extended period of time during the potty training process. She was so excited to get her new potty, her other one is the portable one with the disposable liners which is perfect for travel and on an actual toilet, but more difficult/costly/uncomfortable for actual training. Clean up is easy, she is comfortable sitting on it and the price was spot on!
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Dispenser not deep enough
customer_reviews.text: The dispenser is not deep enough. You can easily have a mess on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for potty training
customer_reviews.text: We used this as a stepping stone from diapers, to little potty, and finally the big one. Easy to clean and portable.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: cute
customer_reviews.text: really cute potty :) we have yet to use it but our kid loves to sit on it! hahaha it is great! at least she is getting used to seeing it :)
customer_reviews.author: Choose How You

customer_reviews.title: Nice potty training seat.
customer_reviews.text: Super comfy seat for kids and finally my kid was potty trained pretty easily. We carry this in car while travelling and fits in rear seating legroom area as well 😊
customer_reviews.author: RS Satish

customer_reviews.title: A must buy!
customer_reviews.text: Potty train doesn’t get any easier! My 9 month old got it right away and isn’t fussy on it. Easy to clean easy to take with u. Keep in the car or at home worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: sofya ostrak

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Height Adjustment, Easy To Clean!
customer_reviews.text: This potty was on the expensive side but if you have a long legged child, almost 2 year old, as mine, The height adjustment was perfect! Durable and easy to clean!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great potty
customer_reviews.text: This was the second potty we bought for my daughter. The first one pinched her bottom and left red marks but this one is comfortable and a perfect fit for her. Easy to clean too!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Bad idea for a toddler with poor aim
customer_reviews.text: This is not the right purchase for a toddler with poor aim. It’s great for sitting down but my son will miss occasionally and the urine ends up draining under the basin and onto the floor. He has a cheaper potty that is much more efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Smitty

customer_reviews.title: We have this and a ring for the normal toilet ...
customer_reviews.text: We have this and a ring for the normal toilet, and my 2 year is way more confident using this little one.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my twin girls and they both screamed and cried when I put them on it. They refused to go potty and turned potty training into a nightmare.. I think it must pinch there little bums cause ive noticed after they sit on it just for a short time they have red marks all over the backside... terrible product will be trying something new
customer_reviews.author: gamer

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Love this potty. The size is right, it’s easy to clean and provides support for the baby.
customer_reviews.author: souraya

customer_reviews.title: Our toddler loves this potty. She has mobility challenges ...
customer_reviews.text: Our toddler loves this potty. She has mobility challenges so we purchased this option with the arms to give additional support and security. Definitely helps with confidence and independence.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra117

customer_reviews.title: It's a potty
customer_reviews.text: Good training potty. Could take on a trip if you needed to but not not particularly compact or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Well made toddler potty
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic toddler potty! Easy to put together, came incredibly fast, and was packaged well. It’s very durable and my toddler seems super interested in learning to use it now.
customer_reviews.author: Taisha Danger Savage

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, portable
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this potty chair. It is easy for her to get on and off and comfortable for her. She can lean back a little and the armrests are perfect. We take it on the go. She can sit on it in the back of the vehicle or even on the backseat.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Best invention ! A Must buy !
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loved it started training at 17 months and she hated the regular toilet seat topper so got her the chair. loved the handles, specially in the morning when she is still drowsy she holds on and isn't scared of falling.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha Reyes

customer_reviews.title: This is the one
customer_reviews.text: It’s comfortable my daughter is tall and it adjusted to her height
customer_reviews.author: Desazray marks

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this potty she’s one and is already learning. This product makes potty train a breeze
customer_reviews.author: Nannerz

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. My kid actually learnt peeing in it and she is in the process of potty training too
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great training potty!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great training potty. The only thing I wish was different is that the bowl would clip into the potty. My kiddo gets a little too interested in removing it and wanting to play with it.
customer_reviews.author: Bean

customer_reviews.title: She can sit down and get up easily with the little arm rests and she "reads" me ...
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loves it. She can sit down and get up easily with the little arm rests and she "reads" me a book as she potty's. Its perfect; doesn't take up a lot of space and easy to use for my granddaughter. Very Satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Lenycha Duran-Butz

customer_reviews.title: Kinda disappointing...
customer_reviews.text: Okay this is a very small potty. Very small...my son out grew it before he could even use it. Not the best buy...
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Berger

customer_reviews.title: Great for a skinny kid but I worry about tall ...
customer_reviews.text: Great for a skinny kid but I worry about tall and chubby kids. Not enough space. My tall one and a half year old won't have room to poop. He sits all the way back just to try to pee. Should be a greater depth and width or have adjustable insert. Love the removable urinal since he wants to stand and pee mostly. He is almost 30 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: V. Hrabak

customer_reviews.title: Dislike very much
customer_reviews.text: 2 year old hates it, refuses to use it. We ended up going a different route to attempt potty training.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: A must have for taller than average, or older toddlers.
customer_reviews.text: A must have for tall toddlers. My daughter loves her potty now (Before it was constant tears and war)... she goes and sits on it proudly and seems really happy and comfortable with it... now we're getting somewhere with potty training.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good starter pottt for little ones
customer_reviews.text: Great seat for a toddler. Only issue is no splash guard, so be prepared to clean up the floor sometimes. Only reason gave 3 stars was because of the lack of splash guard. But it is durable, easy to clean and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.author: Natasha Morris

customer_reviews.title: Good size for a smaller toddler
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I wish was a bit harder to do is to remove the toilet bowl. My kid loves to take it out and play with it. If there were some way to lock it into place, then this would be a perfect training chair.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Super fast shipping!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Third one we’ve ordered (for different locations) extremely fast delivery
customer_reviews.author: John Durham

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price. Ordered for my 2 year old as a back up potty.
customer_reviews.author: Tweet106

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these. One for upstairs, one for downstairs. The only thing I would change about them is to add a spout so emptying them into the toilet would cause less splashing.
customer_reviews.author: Sally C.

product_meta.title: Fisher-Price Custom Comfort Potty
product_meta.description: Color:GreenA potty that helps little ones feel comfortable, secure and relaxed helps make potty training easier! With two adjustable heights (so it’s not too small or too tall), arm rests to hold, and a comfortable, high seat back, Custom Comfort Potty helps little ones confidently get on and off the potty, and feel secure, comfortable and relaxed while they’re sitting, too! The built-in splash guard for boys helps prevent potty training mess and stress, and the one-piece removable bucket and smooth-surface design make clean up a breeze.
feature_bullets: Two-position height adjustable for a custom comfort fit
Armrests and high seat back help little ones feel secure
One-piece bowl easily removes for easy clean up
